alert.note: Alert for Graham (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued August 05 at 8:23PM CDT until August 05 at 9:00PM CDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: The National Weather Service in Goodland has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northeastern Graham County in northwestern Kansas... * Until 900 PM CDT. * At 822 PM CDT, Tornado producing storms were reported along a line extending from 4 miles southwest of Lenora to 4 miles southwest of Hill City, moving east at 25 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * These tornadic storms will be near... Hill City around 830 PM CDT. Bogue around 850 PM CDT. Nicodemus around 900 PM CDT. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris. Heavy rainfall may hide this tornado. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. TAKE COVER NOW! This line of thunderstorms is capable of producing tornadoes and widespread significant wind damage. Do not wait to see or hear the tornado. For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
